results.title: Epilepsy in childhood
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
Parents and children discuss the circumstances and behaviour that led to their child being diagnosed with epilepsy, ranging from seizures to staring into space. They explain their very personal initial reaction to the news, deciding whether to medicate or not, the importance of a good relationship with medical staff, the impact on family and friends, schooling, lifestyle changes, and how their children have changed with age and on receiving medication.

results.title: Epaves
results.brief_description: Shows the underwater life that is discovered during a trip 130 feet below the surface of the sea when exploring shipwrecks near Toulon in the Mediterranean sea. Two deep-sea divers, equipped with special cameras and other equipment, record the lively activity that takes place among the fish and undersea flora and fauna as the men inspect the shipwrecks.

results.title: Eora corroboree
results.creator_credit: Michael Le Moignan, Barbara A. Chobocky, Yuri Sokol and Corroboree Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Black futures (A)”.
For 40,000 years, the Aboriginal people of Australia had a rich and diverse culture, which sprang from and reflected their way of life and beliefs. Their culture was not written, but spoken, sung and performed. Since the coming of white man their culture has very nearly been destroyed. Aboriginal playwright, screenwriter and director Bob Merritt believes that a resurgence of Aboriginal culture is possible and in 1984 set up the Eora Centre for the Visual and Performing Arts in Redfern to offer young Aboriginals a comprehensive education in their traditional arts. Looks at the role of the Eora Centre and interviews some of its teachers and students.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Le Moignan, Barbara A. Chobocky, Yuri Sokol and Corroboree Films

results.title: Enya: Moonshadows
results.creator_credit: M-Oceans Pictures, Warner Music UK and Michael Geoghegan
results.brief_description: This compilation of film clips is a must-see for Enya fans. The film clips add to the dreamy qualities inherent in Enya’s music style. Featuring some of her soundtracks made for film, the compilation includes: Orinoco Flow, Exile, Storm in Africa, Evening Falls, Caribbean Blue.

results.title: Environmental awareness
results.brief_description: This film is a series of finger paintings which demonstrate how the countryside and people are affected by the growth of industry and its consequential pollution. Without words, the film uses music to express mood changes, highlighting environmental situations that emphasise the immediacy of environmental problems today.

results.title: Environment: the British example - a German view = London so long, smog
results.creator_credit: Rudolf Rosthof, NDR TV and Fritz Gebhardt
results.brief_description: In 1952 4,000 people died as a result of “smog”, a mixture of natural fog, soot and smoke, containing poisonous waste gases. The ensuing Clean Air Act designated smokeless zones and all soft coal fires were banned in London. Shows how inspectors keep a close watch on domestic and industrial air pollution, so that smog is a thing of the past.
